greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of integer partitions of n that are empty, or have smallest part dividing all the others, but do not have greatest part divisible by all the others.
comment: First differs from A343346 at a(14) = 79, A343346(14) = 80.
Alternative name: Number of integer partitions of n with a part dividing all the others, but with no part divisible by all the others.
xref: The first condition alone gives A083710.
The half-opposite versions are A130714 and A343342.
The Heinz numbers of these partitions are 1 and A343340.
The second condition alone gives A343341.
A000070 counts partitions with a selected part.
A006128 counts partitions with a selected position.
A015723 counts strict partitions with a selected part.
A018818 counts partitions into divisors (strict: A033630).
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Apr 15 2021
